answers.answer:
New arrivals in Cluj-Napoca can access a wide range of assistance including support for accommodation, meals, and integration, medical and psychological services, legal and social counseling, and free public transport. Specific programs also offer protection, information, and support for women and vulnerable individuals.

To find detailed information, you can read the provided text and look under specific sections such as "Important contacts," "The support program for accommodation, meals and integration in Cluj-Napoca," "Medical services," "Psychological support," and "Organisations offering their support."
answers.bResponse:
New arrivals in Cluj-Napoca can access a wide range of assistance including support for accommodation, meals, and integration, medical and psychological services, legal and social counseling, and free public transport. Specific programs also offer protection, information, and support for women and vulnerable individuals.

To find detailed information, you can read the provided text and look under specific sections such as "Important contacts," "The support program for accommodation, meals and integration in Cluj-Napoca," "Medical services," "Psychological support," and "Organisations offering their support." For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-cluj-napoca

To find this information on the webpage, you would go to `https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-cluj-napoca` and look under the "Important contacts" section.

To find more detailed information, you can refer to the `dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-cluj-napoca` website, especially under the section for "Counseling for people living with HIV". The International Organization for Migration (IOM), World Vision Romania, the Sensiblu Foundation, and PATRIR provide psychological support services.

You can find detailed information about these organizations under the "Psychological support" and "Organisations offering their support" sections on the webpage.

answers.answer:
The Sensiblu Foundation offers social counseling, face-to-face or online psychotherapy, legal advice and representation in court, a support network for women and girls, assistance in obtaining forensic medical certificates, and referral to mediation with other institutions and organizations in Romania.

To find this detailed information on a webpage, you would typically scroll down to the section titled "Organisations offering their support" and then locate the specific listing for "The Sensiblu Foundation" within that section.

Yes, PATRIR offers the "Ukrainian Home - Protection and Support Center" in Cluj-Napoca. This center provides a comprehensive program including protection, information, well-being, inclusiveness, psychosocial support, assistance with injuries, and verified information for Ukrainian refugees.

You can find more detailed information on the website `https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-cluj-napoca` under the section "Organisations offering their support".

Yes, confidential psycho-medical-social HIV services are available for people living with HIV in Romania through specialist doctors from 10 Regional HIV Centers and Sens Pozitiv.

You can find more detailed information on the webpage by visiting https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-cluj-napoca and looking under the "Counseling for people living with HIV" section.
